title: Utility Functions for remoter
text: remoterUtils provides utility functions facilitating management remoter sessions well management authentication objects secure sessions. computing context Windows OS; however, output can readily modified contexts.

title: A remoter Wrapper — connect_remote
text: connect_remote wrapper remoter::client making use predefined encrypted authentication objects

title: A remoter Wrapper — connect_remote
code: connect_remote(   credentials = NULL,   prompt = "REMOTE_SESSION::",   port = NULL,   action = client,   session = make.names(tolower(Sys.getenv("COMPUTERNAME"))),   ... )

title: A remoter Wrapper — connect_remote
text: credentials One following: string: path R workspace image containing cipher key needed connect remote resource TRUE: Choose R workspace image interactively via tk_choose.files 'ENV': See 'Details' NULL|FALSE: Use credentials needed (connections secure) prompt (string) prompt use remote session port (integer) port use provided cipher (useful specific overrides ad-hoc sessions) action (string, symbol) function use connect remote session (e.g., client, batch, etc.) session (string) session prefix ciphers credentials 'ENV' ... used

title: A remoter Wrapper — connect_remote
text: credentials passed 'ENV', Windows environment variable named 'remoter_<cipher prefix>' must already set. content variable JSON string created make_cipher_env.  Expected keys follows: addr: string (IPV4 format) port: numeric,string session: string cipher: string (hexidecimal) nonce: string (hexidecimal, must evaluate length 24L raw vector) shared_key: string (hexidecimal)

title: A remoter Wrapper — connect_remote
text: minimum, read following documentation: client c2s s2c exit

title: Create remoter Authorization Objects — make_cipher
text: remoter_auth creates encrypted object used securely start connect remoter session

title: Create remoter Authorization Objects — make_cipher
code: make_cipher(   file_prefix = make.names(tolower(Sys.getenv("COMPUTERNAME"))),   host_ip,   host_port,   password,   shared_key,   export = FALSE )

title: Create remoter Authorization Objects — make_cipher
text: file_prefix (string) prefix output file user directory suffix "_remoter_auth.rdata" host_ip (string) IPV4 address server (hostnames allowed) host_port (string,integer) port use server: static, reserved port password (string) password server shared_key (string) key encrypt decrypt generated cipher export (logical | FALSE) TRUE, cipher saved user directory "~/"file_prefix_remoter_auth.rdata"

title: Create remoter Authorization Objects — make_cipher
text: cipher (invisibly) required attributes nonce, port, addr

what: Make a Cipher OS Environment Variable — make_cipher_env
title: Make a Cipher OS Environment Variable — make_cipher_env
text: make_cipher_env() creates Windows OS environment variable string provided cipher. OS environment variables beginning 'remoter_' ending target session string searched calling connect_remote credentials = "ENV".

title: Make a Cipher OS Environment Variable — make_cipher_env
code: make_cipher_env(   cipher = NULL,   shared_key = NULL,   session = make.names(tolower(Sys.getenv("COMPUTERNAME"))) )

title: Make a Cipher OS Environment Variable — make_cipher_env
text: cipher NULL,R image holding encryption objects interactively chosen; otherwise, object created make_cipher. shared_key shared key included cipher object, value checked throws error empty session name session environment variable string created

title: Make a Cipher OS Environment Variable — make_cipher_env
text: JSON string can stored Windows OS environment variable formatted "remoter_<session>"
